properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in effect on Macquarie St in the Sydney CBD for a 24 hour arts & culture festival, Mopoke Sydney, starting from 6pm Saturday 4 to 6pm Sunday 5 February.

Macquarie St will be closed between Hunter St and Prince Albert Rd from 6am Sat 4 Feb until 11:59pm Sun 5 Feb. Motorists will be detoured via Elizabeth St.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 5am Sat 4 Feb until 11:59pm Sun 5 Feb on the western side of Macquarie St from Prince Albert Rd to Hunter St. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 166, 167 and 177 buses will divert or end trips early while roads are closed along the course. Visit transportnsw.info for more info and to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sun Run 7km and 10km fun run events will start from 6:15am from The Strand in Dee Why and finish by 9:30am at South Steyne in Manly. Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect. All roads will re-open by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

Road closures:

  • Dee Why - 3.30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde. Crossover maintained on Oaks Ave at The Strand eastbound until 5:15am and westbound until 6am. 
  • Curl Curl to Freshwater - 5:30am to 9am: Griffin Rd, Pitt Rd, Abbott Rd, Carrington Pde and local surrounding roads will be closed. Crossover maintained on Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde in both directions and on Playfair Rd, Ross Rd at Pitt Rd until 6am. 
  • Queenscliff - 5.30am to 10am: sections of Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd, Dowling St, Lumsdaine Dr and surrounding local roads. Crossover maintained westbound (exit only) on Crowd Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am-6:15am and 9am-10am. 
  • Manly - 3.30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads. Managed access for Cameron Ave residents from 5.30am-9am.
  • Manly - 3.30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3am until 9am along sections of roads in Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly including sections of Abbott Rd, Howard Ave, The Strand, Evans St, Crown Rd and North Steyne. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, use the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Dave Chappelle at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday and Sunday. Doors open 5pm, show start from 6pm, finish around 9.30pm.

Multiple events are taking place in the precinct each night with a concert at neighbouring Accor Stadium on Saturday and music festival at Sydney Showground on Sunday.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event each night.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade as part of WorldPride is expected to be bigger than ever this year as the parade returns to its traditional on-road route. Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7:30pm until around 11.30pm.

Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place from as early as 2pm and most roads remain closed until 2am Sunday.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

  • From 2pm to 1am: sections of College St, Wentworth Ave and surounding local streets.
  • From 3pm to 3am: sections of Bourke St, Campbell St and surrounding local streets.
  • From 4pm to 4am: Flinders St between Oxford St and Moore Park Rd, and southbound Anzac Pde from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd, including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open). Anzac Pde closes northbound from 5pm.
  • From 4.30pm to 1am: Liverpool St between Elizabeth St and College St, and local streets in Surry Hills between Elizabeth St and Riley St
  • From 4.30pm to 2am: Oxford St between College St and Darlinghurst Rd, sections of Crown St, sections of South Dowling between Oxford St and Fitzroy St, and local streets off Oxford St.
  • From 6.30pm to 2am: sections of Moore Park Rd and Driver Ave (until 10am Sunday).
  • From 9pm to 1am: sections of Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St between Market and Goulburn streets will close to allow crowds to safely leave the CBD. 

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes.

Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north.  

Pedestrian access across the parade route will be available at Riley St, Crown St and Albion St from 4.30pm to 7pm, after such time there is no pedestrian crossing of Oxford or Flinders Streets available until roads reopen. 

Special event clearways will be in effect between 6am Saturday and 3am Sunday on various roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Central Coast Mariners at Allianz Stadium. Gates open 2pm, women's kick off 2.20pm, men's kick off 5pm, finish 6.45pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 1pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 car park will be closed for this game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 8pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

properties.otherAdvice:
Transmission at Sydney Showground from 3pm to midnight.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run regularly between Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Travel on transport is included in your event ticket Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 15,000 attendees are expected at the Sydney WorldPride Bondi Beach party near Bondi Pavilion on Saturday 4 March. Event starts from 3pm finishing by 10pm.

Traffic approaching Bondi Beach will be heavy along Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. Motorists are encouraged to avoid the area or allow extra travel time and prepare for delays. 

Local roads will be closed around Bondi Beach and North Bondi before during and after the event including sections of Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Drive South.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads from 10am to 11pm on Saturday including Campbell Pde, Gould St, Edgecliff Rd, Grafton St, Hall St, Notts Ave and Roscoe St. Clearways will also be in effect prior to the event on Park Dr South from 27 Feb and Queen Elizabeth Dr from 3 Mar.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride's Oxford Street Party will see Oxford St closed to all vehicle traffic for two days on Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 March.

Motorists will be diverted via Kings Cross or Surry Hills around Oxford St during the closure. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time as delays are expected on detour routes.

Road closures from 12.01am Saturday 4 March until 4.30am Monday 6 March

  • Oxford St between College St and Flinders St
  • Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St
  • Local side streets off Oxford and Flinders streets will also be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 12.01am Saturday 4 March until 4.30am Monday 6 March on Oxford St, Flinders St, Albion St, Crown St, Liverpool St, South Dowling St, Wentworth Ave and surrounding local roads.

Closures for Pride Villages on Riley St, Crown St and surrounding local roads will already be in place from 2am Sun 26 Feb. Clearways will also already be in effect on these streets until 4.30am Mon 6 March.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Sydney FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time for up to an hour between 9.30pm and 10.30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. Note, traffic changes for Parramatta Light Rail may affect how you travel through Parramatta CBD.

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 115, 120 and 267 will be diverting around Victoria Ave from 4.30pm to 9.30pm. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Lunar New Year festivities including a twilight lantern parade will be held along Victoria Ave in Chatswood. Road closures will be in place between 5pm and 8.30pm.

Road closure from 5pm to 8pm during the parade:

  • Hercules St and Oscar St from Chatswood Place car park entrance/exit
  • Victoria Ave between Hercules St and Archer St
  • Bertram St and Neridah St from Victoria Ave to Albert Ave (local access only)
  • Havilah St between Victoria Ave and Nicholson St (local access only)

Road closure from 6.30pm to 8.30pm during the parade:

  • Victoria Ave between Archer St and Anderson St
  • Anderson St from Endeavour St to Charlotte Lane
  • Kirk Street and Mills Lane

Road closure from 7pm to 8.30pm during the parade:

  • Archer St between Albert Ave and Malvern Ave

Motorists will be detour via local roads. Traffic will be heavy so allow plenty of extra travel time.

Exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Route 311 will be detouring around the closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 9pm.

  • Darlinghurst Rd will be closed between Bayswater Rd and Macleay St from 9am to 10:30pm.
  • Sections of Macleay St, Orwell St and Roslyn St will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists can detour around the closures via Greenknowe Ave, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Ward Ave, Bayswater Rd or Craigend St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and Roslyn St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applyDarlin

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride is a once in a lifetime festival coming to Sydney from 17 February to 5 March 2023.

Domain Dance Party will kick off from 3pm, finishing by 11pm.

With thousands of people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St. Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area. Roads will be closed within and outside the Domain to allow crowds to safely arrive and leave the event.

Road closures:

From 7pm to 11.30pm

  • Art Gallery Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd, and Mrs Macquaries Rd.

From 9pm to 11.30pm

  • Cathedral St from St Mary’s Rd
  • College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd (cycleway will also be closed)
  • Hospital Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd 
  • Prince Albert Rd between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • St Mary’s Rd between Yurong Pkwy and Prince Albert Rd

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the Domain from 6pm to 11.30pm on College St, Hospital Rd, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, Shakespeare Pl, St James Rd and St Mary’s Rd.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies
